Article.Abstract: The role of flavivirus-cross-reactive T lymphocytes in recovery from and pathogenesis of flavivirus infections is not known. In the present paper, we have defined a flavivirus-cross-reactive epitope recognized by two CD4+ CD8- cytotoxic T lymphocyte (CTL) clones, JK4 and JK43. The T cell clones were established from the peripheral blood T lymphocytes of a dengue-4-immune donor, using a limiting-dilution method with dengue-4 antigen. These two T cell clones were cross-reactive for dengue virus types 1, 2, 3 and 4, yellow fever virus and West Nile virus, and recognized NS3 protein. The smallest synthetic peptide recognized by these T cell clones was an identical 9 amino acid peptide which contains amino acids 146 to 154 (VIGLYGNGV) of dengue-4 NS3. HLA-DR15 was the restriction allele for recognition of this epitope by JK4 and JK43. JK4 and JK43 both used T cell receptor V alpha 8, but JK4 used V beta 8 and JK43 used V beta 2. This result indicates that this epitope is recognized by two flavivirus-cross-reactive CD4+ T cell clones which originated from different T cells in vivo.
Article.ArticleTitle: Flavivirus-cross-reactive, HLA-DR15-restricted epitope on NS3 recognized by human CD4+ CD8- cytotoxic T lymphocyte clones.
Article.Affiliations: Department of Medicine, University of Massachusetts Medical Center, Worcester 01655, USA.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: CD8 Antigens;HLA-DR Antigens;NS3 protein, flavivirus;Receptors, Antigen, T-Cell, alpha-beta;Viral Nonstructural Proteins;DNA;Serine Endopeptidases;RNA Helicases
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Animals; Base Sequence; CD4-Positive T-Lymphocytes(immunology); CD8 Antigens; Chlorocebus aethiops; Clone Cells; Cross Reactions; DNA; Epitope Mapping; Flavivirus(immunology); HLA-DR Antigens(immunology); Humans; Molecular Sequence Data; RNA Helicases; Receptors, Antigen, T-Cell, alpha-beta(immunology); Sequence Homology, Amino Acid; Serine Endopeptidases; T-Lymphocytes, Cytotoxic(immunology); Vero Cells; Viral Nonstructural Proteins(genetics; immunology)
Article.Comments: Data originally imported from the Database of Functional Molecular Immunology, FIMM (http://sdmc.lit.org.sg:8080/fimm/) and from the HLA Ligand Database (http://hlaligand.ouhsc.edu/)

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Data originally imported from the Database of Functional Molecular Immunology, FIMM (http://sdmc.lit.org.sg:8080/fimm/) and from the HLA Ligand Database (http://hlaligand.ouhsc.edu/) and recurated. The following refers to the epitope id as found in the original FIMM database: P001100 The identical sequence is found in the flaviviruses West Nile virus and Kunjin virus.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were obtained from a donor 6 and 12 months after immunization with a live attenuated experimental dengue-3 (CH53489) vaccine. The donor had been immunized with the YF vaccine 1 year earlier. T cell clones were established by culturing PBMC for 7 days with dengue virus type 3 antigen and restimulating the blasts with irradiated autologous PBMC and dengue virus type 3 antigen, followed by limiting dilution.

Antigen.AntigenReferenceName: Dengue-2 antigen extract of infected cells

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Two epitope-specific CD4+ cytotoxic T cell clones (JK43 and JK4) lysed autologous LCL pulsed with dengue-2 antigen. The epitope and the homologous dengue-2 sequence (VVGLYGNGV) differ at position 2. The CTL clones were shown to recognize a flavivirus cross-reactive epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were obtained from a donor 6 and 12 months after immunization with a live attenuated experimental dengue-3 (CH53489) vaccine. The donor had been immunized with the YF vaccine 1 year earlier. T cell clones were established by culturing PBMC for 7 days with dengue virus type 3 antigen and restimulating the blasts with irradiated autologous PBMC and dengue virus type 3 antigen, followed by limiting dilution.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Truncation analysis established the epitope as the minimal sequence recognized by two CD4+ cytotoxic T cell clones (JK43 and JK4) that recognize a flavivirus-cross-reactive epitope. The CTL clones were shown to recognize the 15-mer peptide (NRKGKVIGLYGNGVV), containing the epitope, in the context of HLA-DR15 by using a panel of allogeneic target cells pulsed with the epitope. The two epitope-specific clones were shown to originate from different T cells in vivo because they used different T cell receptor VÎ² segments.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were obtained from a donor 6 and 12 months after immunization with a live attenuated experimental dengue-3 (CH53489) vaccine. The donor had been immunized with the YF vaccine 1 year earlier. T cell clones were established by culturing PBMC for 7 days with dengue virus type 3 antigen and restimulating the blasts with irradiated autologous PBMC and dengue virus type 3 antigen, followed by limiting dilution.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Two epitope-specific CD4+ cytotoxic T cell clones (JK43 and JK4) lysed autologous LCL infected with vaccinia virus containing the dengue-2 or dengue-3 NS3 gene. The epitope and the homologous sequence (VVGLYGNGV) found in dengue-2 and dengue-3 NS3 differ at position 2. The CTL clones were shown to recognize a flavivirus cross-reactive epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were obtained from a donor 6 and 12 months after immunization with a live attenuated experimental dengue-3 (CH53489) vaccine. The donor had been immunized with the YF vaccine 1 year earlier. T cell clones were established by culturing PBMC for 7 days with dengue virus type 3 antigen and restimulating the blasts with irradiated autologous PBMC and dengue virus type 3 antigen, followed by limiting dilution.

Antigen.AntigenReferenceName: Dengue-1 antigen extract of infected cells

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Two epitope-specific CD4+ cytotoxic T cell clones (JK43 and JK4) lysed autologous LCL pulsed with dengue-1 antigen. The epitope and the homologous dengue-1 sequence (IVGLYGNGV) differ at positions 1 and 2. The CTL clones were shown to recognize a flavivirus cross-reactive epitope.

The donor had been immunized with the YF vaccine 1 year earlier. T cell clones were established by culturing PBMC for 7 days with dengue virus type 3 antigen and restimulating the blasts with irradiated autologous PBMC and dengue virus type 3 antigen, followed by limiting dilution.

Antigen.AntigenReferenceName: Yellow fever virus antigen extract of infected cells

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Two epitope-specific CD4+ cytotoxic T cell clones (JK43 and JK4) lysed autologous LCL pulsed with Yellow fever virus antigen. The epitope and the homologous YFV sequence (VIGLYGNGI) differ at position 9. The CTL clones were shown to recognize a flavivirus cross-reactive epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were obtained from a donor 6 and 12 months after immunization with a live attenuated experimental dengue-3 (CH53489) vaccine. The donor had been immunized with the YF vaccine 1 year earlier. T cell clones were established by culturing PBMC for 7 days with dengue virus type 3 antigen and restimulating the blasts with irradiated autologous PBMC and dengue virus type 3 antigen, followed by limiting dilution.

Antigen.AntigenReferenceName: West Nile virus antigen extract of infected cells

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Two epitope-specific CD4+ cytotoxic T cell clones (JK43 and JK4) lysed autologous LCL pulsed with West Nile virus antigen. The identical epitope sequence is also found in Dengue 4 virus NS3. The CTL clones were shown to recognize a flavivirus cross-reactive epitope.
